meta.title: Set up Redis connection and rate limiting infrastructure

task.role: You are a Senior Security Engineer with expertise in authentication and secure coding. Implement Task 4 with production-quality code.

context.overview: Configure Redis connection pool and implement token bucket rate limiting for authenticated and anonymous users
context.background: Review PRD and architecture in .tasks/docs/ for full context.

requirements.description: 1. Create src/infra/redis.rs with connection manager setup 2. Implement rate limiter in src/api/middleware/rate_limit.rs: - Use Redis INCR with TTL for sliding window counter - Key pattern: rate_limit:{ip_or_user_id}:{minute_window} - Limits: 100 req/min for authenticated, 20 req/min for anonymous - Return 429 Too Many Requests when exceeded 3. Create middleware layer that: - Extracts user_id from auth context or falls back to IP - Checks current count in Redis - Increments counter with EXPIRE 60 - Adds X-RateLimit-* headers to response 4. Apply middleware globally in router configuration

constraints.constraint: PR title: feat(task-4): Set up Redis connection and rate limiting infrastructure

acceptance_criteria.criterion: Unit test rate limit logic with mock Redis. Integration test: make 21 anonymous requests rapidly, verify 429 on 21st. Test authenticated user gets 100 req/min limit
